ci_support_linux_64_r_base4.4.yaml:
c_compiler:
- gcc
c_compiler_version:
- '14'
c_stdlib:
- sysroot
c_stdlib_version:
- '2.17'
cdt_name:
- conda
channel_sources:
- conda-forge
channel_targets:
- conda-forge main
cran_mirror:
- https://cran.r-project.org
docker_image:
- quay.io/condaforge/linux-anvil-x86_64:alma9
pin_run_as_build:
  r-base:
    min_pin: x.x
    max_pin: x.x
r_base:
- '4.4'
target_platform:
- linux-64

about.summary: Bindings to GnuPG for working with OpenGPG (RFC4880) cryptographic methods. Includes utilities for public key encryption, creating and verifying digital signatures, and managing your local keyring. Some functionality depends on the version of GnuPG that is installed on the system. On Windows this package can be used together with 'GPG4Win' which provides a GUI for managing keys and entering passphrases.

Bindings to GnuPG for working with OpenGPG (RFC4880) cryptographic methods. Includes utilities for public key encryption, creating and verifying digital signatures, and managing your local keyring. Some functionality depends on the version of GnuPG that is installed on the system. On Windows this package can be used together with 'GPG4Win' which provides a GUI for managing keys and entering passphrases.

name: r-gpg

about.summary: Bindings to GnuPG for working with OpenGPG (RFC4880) cryptographic methods. Includes utilities for public key encryption, creating and verifying digital signatures, and managing your local keyring. Some functionality depends on the version of GnuPG that is installed on the system. On Windows this package can be used together with 'GPG4Win' which provides a GUI for managing keys and entering passphrases.

raw_meta_yaml:
{% set version = "1.3.0" %}
{% set posix = 'm2-' if win else '' %}

package:
  name: r-gpg
  version: {{ version|replace("-", "_") }}

source:
  url:
    - {{ cran_mirror }}/src/contrib/gpg_{{ version }}.tar.gz
    - {{ cran_mirror }}/src/contrib/Archive/gpg/gpg_{{ version }}.tar.gz
  sha256: 03bc36b621a8463ab922089486cbc7bbfbdb2f47e3eebf476a2fd26e77af1612

build:
  skip: true  # [win]
  number: 1
  rpaths:
    - lib/R/lib/
    - lib/

requirements:
  build:
    - {{ stdlib("c") }}
    - {{ compiler('c') }}              # [not win]
    - {{ compiler('m2w64_c') }}        # [win]
    - {{ posix }}filesystem        # [win]
    - {{ posix }}sed               # [win]
    - {{ posix }}grep              # [win]
    - {{ posix }}autoconf
    - {{ posix }}automake          # [not win]
    - {{ posix }}automake-wrapper  # [win]
    - pkg-config
    - {{ posix }}make
    - {{ posix }}coreutils         # [win]
    - {{ posix }}zip               # [win]
    - cross-r-base {{ r_base }}    # [build_platform != target_platform]
  host:
    - r-base
    - r-askpass
    - r-curl
    - gpgme
    - gnupg
  run:
    - r-base
    - r-askpass
    - r-curl
    - gpgme
    - gnupg

test:
  commands:
    - $R -e "library('gpg')"           # [not win]
    - "\"%R%\" -e \"library('gpg')\""  # [win]

about:
  home: https://github.com/jeroen/gpg
  license: MIT
  summary: Bindings to GnuPG for working with OpenGPG (RFC4880) cryptographic methods. Includes utilities for public key encryption, creating and verifying digital signatures, and managing your local keyring. Some functionality depends on the version of GnuPG that is installed on the system. On Windows this package can be
    used together with 'GPG4Win' which provides a GUI for managing keys and entering passphrases.
  license_family: MIT
  license_file:
    - '{{ environ["PREFIX"] }}/lib/R/share/licenses/MIT'
    - LICENSE

extra:
  recipe-maintainers:
    - conda-forge/r
    - thewchan

# Package: gpg
# Type: Package
# Title: GNU Privacy Guard for R
# Version: 1.2.9
# Authors@R: person("Jeroen", "Ooms", email = "jeroen@berkeley.edu", comment = c(ORCID = "0000-0002-4035-0289"), role = c("aut", "cre"))
# Description: Bindings to GnuPG for working with OpenGPG (RFC4880) cryptographic methods. Includes utilities for public key encryption, creating and verifying digital signatures, and managing your local keyring. Some functionality depends on the version of GnuPG that is installed on the system. On Windows this package can be used together with 'GPG4Win' which provides a GUI for managing keys and entering passphrases.
# License: MIT + file LICENSE
# SystemRequirements: GPGME: libgpgme-dev (deb), gpgme-devel (rpm) gpgme (brew). On Linux 'haveged' is recommended for generating entropy when using the GPG key generator.
# RoxygenNote: 7.2.3
# Imports: curl, askpass
# Suggests: knitr, rmarkdown
# VignetteBuilder: knitr
# URL: https://github.com/jeroen/gpg
# BugReports: https://github.com/jeroen/gpg/issues
# Encoding: UTF-8
# NeedsCompilation: yes
# Packaged: 2023-05-16 13:39:27 UTC; jeroen
# Author: Jeroen Ooms [aut, cre] (<https://orcid.org/0000-0002-4035-0289>)
# Maintainer: Jeroen Ooms <jeroen@berkeley.edu>
# Repository: CRAN
# Date/Publication: 2023-05-18 10:30:10 UTC
